definition: lightning/electricity/electric (bound form)/to get (or give) an electric shock/phone call or telegram etc/to send via telephone or telegram etc

sentences.english: It is a little pity that the dry battery of my MP3 is dead now.
sentences.chinese: 有点遗憾的是，现在我MP3的干电池没电了。

sentences.english: I’ve only sparked it a bit to keep the battery alive.
sentences.chinese: 我只发动了几次，防止电瓶没电了。

sentences.english: The battery is dead. The car won't start.
sentences.chinese: 电池没电了，车子发动不起来。

sentences.english: After all, none of the functions work once the phone’s battery is dead.
sentences.chinese: 毕竟，一旦手机电池没电了，那些功能将全部丧失。

sentences.english: We have a dead battery now, I'd better put this car in service.
sentences.chinese: 电池没电了，我想我该把车送去保养了。

sentences.english: It rang continuously for five and a half hours before it finally ran out of batteries.
sentences.chinese: 于是闹钟一直响了五个半小时没电了才停下来。

sentences.english: My phone had died during the evening so I couldn't call anyone.
sentences.chinese: 手机昨天傍晚就没电了，我没法打电话给任何人。

sentences.english: Traffic lights off. Hospitals deprived of electricity.
sentences.chinese: 红绿灯也关了，连医院都没电。

definition: to turn off (a machine or device)/to finish shooting a film
quantity of electric charge or current
to recharge (a battery)/(fig.) to recharge one's batteries (through leisure)/to update one's skills and knowledge
to leak electricity/(fig.) (coll.) to unintentionally arouse romantic interest (by being solicitous etc)/cf. 放電|放电[fang4 dian4]
(of a circuit breaker or switch) to trip
(of a circuit breaker or switch) to trip
